results.title: Bayside reflections: Port Phillip Bay on film
results.brief_description: A two-part series composed of archival films, newsreels, stills and personal stories about Port Phillip Bay and its surrounds, its history, architect, beaches, piers and lifestyle from the late 1800s through to the 1990s.

results.title: Batu caves
results.brief_description: A group of school children explores Batu Caves in Kuala Lumpur and discover interesting examples of Malayan wild life. Many varieties of bats are the chief inhabitants, while various insects, snails, crickets, centipedes, scorpions, white snakes and small crustaceans are also to be found. No other credits available.

results.title: Battlefield pilot
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Defence and Vincent Donovan
results.brief_description: Australian Army pilots are among the best low level fliers in the world. The film demonstrates their skill by observing in depth a low level training flight by an Army pilot in a Pilatus Porter aircraft.

results.title: Battle scars: an overview of our defence against disease
results.creator_credit: East Australian Film Corporation, VEA and Bob Hardie
results.brief_description: This program investigates the Human immune system and what defences the human body has against disease. Topics covered in this area include: physical barriers against disease, means of pathogenic entry into the body, defences of the body against entry of pathogens, antigens and antibodies, role of phagocytes, the immune system and its function, the nature of immunity, vaccines and their development and the function of antibiotics.

results.title: Battle of the road
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Australian Road Safety Council, Hugh Alexander and Bern Gandy
results.brief_description: Begins by showing the destruction of human life in wartime from modern weapons of war, and then stresses the need to prevent “the battle of the roads” which causes comparable casualties in peace time. The film points out common driving mistakes made by motorists, and shows how the carelessness of pedestrians also causes many accidents. The effects of speed upon the time to brake cars is shown. The huge loss of production each year and the heavy financial burden on the nation due to accidents is emphasised.

results.title: Battle for the land. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Chris Bryer, Ian McFarlane and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Politics of food”.
These episodes in the “Politics of Food” series examine poverty and hunger in Brazil. Brazil is one of the world leaders in food exports yet 1 in 8 children in poor areas will die from malnutrition. Much of the land which could be used to produce food crops is given over to high yield export crops such as sugar and cocoa. With little land to grow food many of the rural population have migrated to the cities where urban poverty is rife. As a consequence, corruption and violence are evident as the battle between wealthy landowners and the impoverished continues.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Bryer, Ian McFarlane and Yorkshire Television
